Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer M Polzin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $750.00 cash bond applied and balance to be refunded. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Defendant Jennifer M Polzin in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. 
Defendant pleads guilty to Count 3. Court questions, accepts plea and finds guilty.
Court dismisses and reads-in counts 1 & 2.

State requests Court to follow plea agreement.

Defendant addresses Court.

Court relates and orders:
Court costs - bond posted to be applied and 60 days to pay any balance.  Refund any balance of bond.

Order to Submit DNA Specimen given to Defendant.  Court orders defendant to submit to DNA today.

Defendant Jennifer M Polzin in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State indicates it will file amended information with misdemeanor charges only. Based on this, Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts Defendant's waiver, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Defense makes bond modification request to allow contact with the victim. State has no objection to eliminating no contact provision. Court grants modification to eliminate no contact provision and also adds a condition that Defendant may not drive any vehicle owned by D.E.  Arraignment scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
